intro: Kielmeyera petiolaris var. cipoensis, commonly known as the Cipo ceiba, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces fleshy, orange-red fruits that contain seeds surrounded by a sticky, aromatic pulp. It is often found in moist, tropical lowland areas and plays a role in the local ecosystem as a food source for various wildlife. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important subject of botanical study.
